trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection playbook | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection playbook | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how Azure AD Identity Protection enables you to limit the ability of an attacker to exploit a compromised identity or device and to secure an identity or a device that was previously suspected or known to be compromised.
trans-unit.target: Learn how Azure AD Identity Protection enables you to limit the ability of an attacker to exploit a compromised identity or device and to secure an identity or a device that was previously suspected or known to be compromised.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection playbook
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection playbook

trans-unit.source: This playbook helps you to:
trans-unit.target: This playbook helps you to:

trans-unit.source: Populate data in the Identity Protection environment by simulating risk events and vulnerabilities
trans-unit.target: Populate data in the Identity Protection environment by simulating risk events and vulnerabilities

trans-unit.source: Set up risk-based conditional access policies and test the impact of these policies
trans-unit.target: Set up risk-based conditional access policies and test the impact of these policies

trans-unit.source: Simulating Risk Events
trans-unit.target: Simulating Risk Events

trans-unit.source: This section provides you with steps for simulating the following risk event types:
trans-unit.target: This section provides you with steps for simulating the following risk event types:

trans-unit.source: Sign-ins from anonymous IP addresses (easy)
trans-unit.target: Sign-ins from anonymous IP addresses (easy)

trans-unit.source: Sign-ins from unfamiliar locations (moderate)
trans-unit.target: Sign-ins from unfamiliar locations (moderate)

trans-unit.source: Impossible travel to atypical locations (difficult)
trans-unit.target: Impossible travel to atypical locations (difficult)

trans-unit.source: Other risk events cannot be simulated in a secure manner.
trans-unit.target: Other risk events cannot be simulated in a secure manner.

trans-unit.source: Sign-ins from anonymous IP addresses
trans-unit.target: Sign-ins from anonymous IP addresses

trans-unit.source: This risk event type identifies users who have successfully signed in from an IP address that has been identified as an anonymous proxy IP address.
trans-unit.target: This risk event type identifies users who have successfully signed in from an IP address that has been identified as an anonymous proxy IP address.

trans-unit.source: These proxies are used by people who want to hide their device’s IP address and may be used for malicious intent.
trans-unit.target: These proxies are used by people who want to hide their device’s IP address and may be used for malicious intent.

trans-unit.source: **To simulate a sign-in from an anonymous IP, perform the following steps**:
trans-unit.target: **To simulate a sign-in from an anonymous IP, perform the following steps**:

trans-unit.source: Download the [Tor Browser](https://www.torproject.org/projects/torbrowser.html.en).
trans-unit.target: Download the [Tor Browser](https://www.torproject.org/projects/torbrowser.html.en).

trans-unit.source: Using the Tor Browser, navigate to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: Using the Tor Browser, navigate to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com).

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials of the account you want to appear in the **Sign-ins from anonymous IP addresses** report.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials of the account you want to appear in the **Sign-ins from anonymous IP addresses** report.

trans-unit.source: The sign-in will show up on the Identity Protection dashboard within 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The sign-in will show up on the Identity Protection dashboard within 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Sign-ins from unfamiliar locations
trans-unit.target: Sign-ins from unfamiliar locations

trans-unit.source: The unfamiliar locations risk is a real-time sign-in evaluation mechanism that considers past sign-in locations (IP, Latitude / Longitude and ASN) to determine new / unfamiliar locations.
trans-unit.target: The unfamiliar locations risk is a real-time sign-in evaluation mechanism that considers past sign-in locations (IP, Latitude / Longitude and ASN) to determine new / unfamiliar locations.

trans-unit.source: The system stores previous IPs, Latitude / Longitude, and ASNs of a user and considers these to be familiar locations.
trans-unit.target: The system stores previous IPs, Latitude / Longitude, and ASNs of a user and considers these to be familiar locations.

trans-unit.source: A sign-in location is considered unfamiliar if the sign-in location does not match any of the existing familiar locations.
trans-unit.target: A sign-in location is considered unfamiliar if the sign-in location does not match any of the existing familiar locations.

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection:
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory Identity Protection:

trans-unit.source: has an initial learning period of 14 days during which it does not flag any new locations as unfamiliar locations.
trans-unit.target: has an initial learning period of 14 days during which it does not flag any new locations as unfamiliar locations.

trans-unit.source: ignores sign-ins from familiar devices and locations that are geographically close to an existing familiar location.
trans-unit.target: ignores sign-ins from familiar devices and locations that are geographically close to an existing familiar location.

trans-unit.source: To simulate unfamiliar locations, you have to sign in from a location and device that the account has not signed in from before.
trans-unit.target: To simulate unfamiliar locations, you have to sign in from a location and device that the account has not signed in from before.

trans-unit.source: **To simulate a sign-in from an unfamiliar location, perform the following steps**:
trans-unit.target: **To simulate a sign-in from an unfamiliar location, perform the following steps**:

trans-unit.source: Choose an account that has at least a 14-day sign-in history.
trans-unit.target: Choose an account that has at least a 14-day sign-in history.

trans-unit.source: Do either:
trans-unit.target: Do either:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: While using a VPN, navigate to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com) and enter the credentials of the account you want to simulate the risk event for.
trans-unit.target: While using a VPN, navigate to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com) and enter the credentials of the account you want to simulate the risk event for.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: Ask an associate in a different location to sign in using the account’s credentials (not recommended).
trans-unit.target: Ask an associate in a different location to sign in using the account’s credentials (not recommended).

trans-unit.source: The sign-in will show up on the Identity Protection dashboard within 5 minutes.
trans-unit.target: The sign-in will show up on the Identity Protection dashboard within 5 minutes.

trans-unit.source: Impossible travel to atypical location
trans-unit.target: Impossible travel to atypical location

trans-unit.source: Simulating the impossible travel condition is difficult because the algorithm uses machine learning to weed out false-positives such as impossible travel from familiar devices, or sign-ins from VPNs that are used by other users in the directory.
trans-unit.target: Simulating the impossible travel condition is difficult because the algorithm uses machine learning to weed out false-positives such as impossible travel from familiar devices, or sign-ins from VPNs that are used by other users in the directory.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, the algorithm requires a sign-in history of 3 to 14 days for the user before it begins generating risk events.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, the algorithm requires a sign-in history of 3 to 14 days for the user before it begins generating risk events.

trans-unit.source: **To simulate an impossible travel to atypical location, perform the following steps**:
trans-unit.target: **To simulate an impossible travel to atypical location, perform the following steps**:

trans-unit.source: Using your standard browser, navigate to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com).
trans-unit.target: Using your standard browser, navigate to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com).

trans-unit.source: Enter the credentials of the account you want to generate an impossible travel risk event for.
trans-unit.target: Enter the credentials of the account you want to generate an impossible travel risk event for.

trans-unit.source: Change your user agent.
trans-unit.target: Change your user agent.

trans-unit.source: You can change user agent in Internet Explorer from Developer Tools, or change your user agent in Firefox or Chrome using a user-agent switcher add-on.
trans-unit.target: You can change user agent in Internet Explorer from Developer Tools, or change your user agent in Firefox or Chrome using a user-agent switcher add-on.

trans-unit.source: Change your IP address.
trans-unit.target: Change your IP address.

trans-unit.source: You can change your IP address by using a VPN, a Tor add-on, or spinning up a new machine in Azure in a different data center.
trans-unit.target: You can change your IP address by using a VPN, a Tor add-on, or spinning up a new machine in Azure in a different data center.

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com) using the same credentials as before and within a few minutes after the previous sign-in.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to [https://myapps.microsoft.com](https://myapps.microsoft.com) using the same credentials as before and within a few minutes after the previous sign-in.

trans-unit.source: The sign-in will show up in the Identity Protection dashboard within 2-4 hours.
trans-unit.target: The sign-in will show up in the Identity Protection dashboard within 2-4 hours.

trans-unit.source: Because of the complex machine learning models involved, there is a chance it will not get picked up.
trans-unit.target: Because of the complex machine learning models involved, there is a chance it will not get picked up.

trans-unit.source: You might want to replicate these steps for multiple Azure AD accounts.
trans-unit.target: You might want to replicate these steps for multiple Azure AD accounts.

trans-unit.source: Simulating vulnerabilities
trans-unit.target: Simulating vulnerabilities

trans-unit.source: Vulnerabilities are weaknesses in an Azure AD environment that can be exploited by a bad actor.
trans-unit.target: Vulnerabilities are weaknesses in an Azure AD environment that can be exploited by a bad actor.

trans-unit.source: Currently 3 types of vulnerabilities are surfaced in Azure AD Identity Protection that leverage other features of Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Currently 3 types of vulnerabilities are surfaced in Azure AD Identity Protection that leverage other features of Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: These Vulnerabilities will be displayed on the Identity Protection dashboard automatically once these features are set up.
trans-unit.target: These Vulnerabilities will be displayed on the Identity Protection dashboard automatically once these features are set up.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD [Multi-Factor Authentication?](../multi-factor-authentication/multi-factor-authentication.md)
trans-unit.target: Azure AD [Multi-Factor Authentication?](../multi-factor-authentication/multi-factor-authentication.md)

trans-unit.source: Azure AD [Cloud App Discovery](active-directory-cloudappdiscovery-whatis.md).
trans-unit.target: Azure AD [Cloud App Discovery](active-directory-cloudappdiscovery-whatis.md).

trans-unit.source: Azure AD [Privileged Identity Management](active-directory-privileged-identity-management-configure.md).
trans-unit.target: Azure AD [Privileged Identity Management](active-directory-privileged-identity-management-configure.md).

trans-unit.source: User compromise risk
trans-unit.target: User compromise risk

trans-unit.source: **To test User compromise risk, perform the following steps**:
trans-unit.target: **To test User compromise risk, perform the following steps**:

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to [https://portal.azure.com](https://portal.azure.com) with global administrator credentials for your tenant.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to [https://portal.azure.com](https://portal.azure.com) with global administrator credentials for your tenant.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Identity Protection**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Identity Protection**.

trans-unit.source: On the main **Azure AD Identity Protection** blade, click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: On the main **Azure AD Identity Protection** blade, click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Portal Settings** blade, under **Security rules**, click **User compromise risk**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Portal Settings** blade, under **Security rules**, click **User compromise risk**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Sign in Risk** blade, turn **Enable rule** off, and then click **Save** settings.
trans-unit.target: On the **Sign in Risk** blade, turn **Enable rule** off, and then click **Save** settings.

trans-unit.source: For a given user account, simulate an unfamiliar locations or anonymous IP risk event.
trans-unit.target: For a given user account, simulate an unfamiliar locations or anonymous IP risk event.

trans-unit.source: This will elevate the user risk level for that user to **Medium**.
trans-unit.target: This will elevate the user risk level for that user to **Medium**.

trans-unit.source: Wait a few minutes, and then verify that user level for your user is **Medium**.
trans-unit.target: Wait a few minutes, and then verify that user level for your user is **Medium**.

trans-unit.source: Go to the **Portal Settings** blade.
trans-unit.target: Go to the **Portal Settings** blade.

trans-unit.source: On the **User Compromise Risk** blade, under **Enable rule**, select **On** .
trans-unit.target: On the **User Compromise Risk** blade, under **Enable rule**, select **On** .

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: To block, select **Medium** under **Block sign in**.
trans-unit.target: To block, select **Medium** under **Block sign in**.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: To enforce secure password change, select **Medium** under **Require multi-factor authentication**.
trans-unit.target: To enforce secure password change, select **Medium** under **Require multi-factor authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You can now test risk-based conditional access by signing in using a user with an elevated risk level.
trans-unit.target: You can now test risk-based conditional access by signing in using a user with an elevated risk level.

trans-unit.source: If the user risk is Medium, depending on the configuration of your policy, your sign-in is be either blocked or you are forced to change your password.
trans-unit.target: If the user risk is Medium, depending on the configuration of your policy, your sign-in is be either blocked or you are forced to change your password.

trans-unit.source: Playbook
trans-unit.target: Playbook

trans-unit.source: Sign-in risk
trans-unit.target: Sign-in risk

trans-unit.source: To test a sign in risk, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To test a sign in risk, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to [https://portal.azure.com ](https://portal.azure.com) with global administrator credentials for your tenant.
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to [https://portal.azure.com ](https://portal.azure.com) with global administrator credentials for your tenant.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Identity Protection**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Identity Protection**.

trans-unit.source: On the main **Azure AD Identity Protection** blade, click **Settings**.
trans-unit.target: On the main **Azure AD Identity Protection** blade, click **Settings**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Portal Settings** blade, under **Security rules**, click **Sign in risk**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Portal Settings** blade, under **Security rules**, click **Sign in risk**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Sign in Risk **blade, select **On** under **Enable rule**.
trans-unit.target: On the **Sign in Risk **blade, select **On** under **Enable rule**.

trans-unit.source: Select one of the following options:
trans-unit.target: Select one of the following options:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: To block, select **Medium** under **Block sign in**
trans-unit.target: To block, select **Medium** under **Block sign in**

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: To enforce secure password change, select **Medium** under **Require multi-factor authentication**.
trans-unit.target: To enforce secure password change, select **Medium** under **Require multi-factor authentication**.

trans-unit.source: To block, select Medium under Block sign in.
trans-unit.target: To block, select Medium under Block sign in.

trans-unit.source: To enforce multi-factor authentication, select **Medium** under **Require multi-factor authentication**.
trans-unit.target: To enforce multi-factor authentication, select **Medium** under **Require multi-factor authentication**.

trans-unit.source: Click on **Save**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Save**.

trans-unit.source: You can now test risk-based conditional access by simulating the unfamiliar locations or anonymous IP risk events because they are both **Medium** risk events.
trans-unit.target: You can now test risk-based conditional access by simulating the unfamiliar locations or anonymous IP risk events because they are both **Medium** risk events.
